thread.title: Elizabeth Warren, Jeff Sessions: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
thread.title_full: Elizabeth Warren, Jeff Sessions: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

author: KAREN ZRAICK and SANDRA STEVENSON
title: Elizabeth Warren, Jeff Sessions: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

organizations.name: credit damon winter/the new york times
photo credit andrew jacobs/the new york times

text:
Photo Credit Damon Winter/The New York Times 3. It’s love, interrupted. For couples trying to navigate America’s immigration system, the president’s executive order has thrown relationships into turmoil . Jehan Mouhsen, above, is pregnant and waiting in New York for her husband, a Syrian doctor who played a crucial role vaccinating more than a million children in his country as polio was on the rise. He’s stuck in Turkey. “I’ve been arrested, and I’ve been tortured and everything,” he said by phone. “But my wife, she doesn’t have to suffer this.” Credit Khaled Abdullah/Reuters.. 4. Two important developments in counterterrorism news: The White House is finishing an executive order for the Pentagon to bring future Islamic State detainees to Guantánamo Bay prison, according to administration officials and a draft order obtained by The Times. And Yemen has withdrawn permission for U.S. Special Operations ground missions in its country amid outrage over civilian casualties in a commando raid, the first authorized by Mr. Trump. Photo Credit Bryan Denton for The New York Times 5. We visited five cities along the U.S.-Mexico border, where many are anxious about what a new wall might mean . An 18-year-old in Nogales, Mexico, suggested that Mr. Trump could take an even larger role in the construction. “This guy is supposed to be a billionaire, right?” he asked. “Why the hell can’t he pay for it himself, then?” 
Advertisement Above, the existing wall in Tijuana. Photo Credit Reuters.. 6. A Russian judge convicted the opposition politician Aleksei Navalny , above left, on fraud charges, increasing the likelihood of President Vladimir Putin’s election to a fourth term next year. Mr. Navalny promised to appeal, writing on Twitter: “Putin and his gang of thieves are afraid to face us in elections. Rightly so: We will win.” Photo Credit Andrew Jacobs/The New York Times 7. In East Africa, there are celebrations for a new railway line from Djibouti to Ethiopia that showcases China’s effort to extend its influence on the continent with aid and expertise. Not everyone is comfortable with China’s vision for Africa , but there’s a lot to embrace. In tiny Djibouti, that means $14 billion worth of projects, including three ports, two airports, a water pipeline and jobs for thousands of local workers.
